page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Mrs.Powell Edwards owns Novington Manor.Her husband's family has been living there for about 100 years.The house was built in the 16th century and rebuilt in 1820.She owns 1000 acres on which there are a variety of ponds with tench and perch in.There is an oak which is about 100 years old.A relation of hers lives at Stantons farm. The race course was built 101 years ago.On the railway bridge people sit on race days and watch the races free. There is a small stadium and when you are at the old school you can hear the commentator.Prince Charles raced here on the 4th March 1980 on a horse called Long Wharf. Plumpton Mill,which still exists in working order ,is powered by water.
